title: Can't send email notifications to recipients because of invalid email domain
content:
The system can't send email notifications to recipients because of the following error in the suite log:

ServiceException - ValidationFailedException: Message validation failed. Details: [1: Email address fromEmail=xxxx@<email domain> is invalid. 2: Email address recipientEmail=xxxx_xx@<email domain> is invalid.].: (isRecoverable: false)

Where: <email domain> is the domain of the email address.

Cause

The email domain is not in the email domain allowlist. Before sending the email notification, the system validates the email domain. When the validation fails, the system stops sending the notification. 

Solution

  • If the recipient is an email address, perform both Task 1 and Task 2 to add the email domain to Authorized domains for navigation and Recipient allowlist.
  • If the recipient is a user, perform only Task 1 to add the email domain to Authorized domains for navigation.

Task 1 Add the email domain to Authorized domains for navigation

  1. As the tenant admin, navigate to Administration > Application Settings.
  2. In the Authorized domains for navigation field, enter * to authorize all domains or add the email domain to the existing list of authorized domains (comma-separated).
  3. Click Save.

Task 2 Add the email domain to Recipient allowlist

  1. As the tenant admin, navigate to Administration > Application Settings.
  2. In the Recipient allowlist field, enter the email domains (semicolon-separated). Please make sure to enter only the domains, for example, example.com. Leaving this field empty will stop emails from being sent to any external recipients. On the contrary, entering * will allow the domain check to be bypassed and may cause potential security risks.
  3. Click Save.
